column5: Going through my photos of my winter adventures so far...first trip out was Dec. 9 I believe and conditions were mostly great for the first half of the winter, but given the huge amounts of snow we just got and the week of warm weather coming in, that's gonna change fast lolsplakeLots of little guys, lots of great meals, not so many memorable fish but the numbers were there. Kinda what splake fishing is about on the easy access lakes in this area...brook troutdidn't spend a whole lot of days targetting brookies so far this winter, but definitely made some awesome memories and went on some wicked adventures chasing these beauties aroundwalleyespent more time targetting walleye this winter than I usually do, and I loved every minute of it. Even got to spend a few trips on the ice with my girlfriend, which is no easy feat now that we both work shift work with a young daughter at home.Some Nipissing action...the big lake has been fantastic for numbers and at least one keeper every trip, usually more than that. Still no big girls, but we're not really in hog season yet anyways.The fabled blue walleye of the Kipawa regionIncidental catchand everyone's favourite... Who's coming brook trout fishing with me?
dang, some good fishing right there
Dude, I'll make the trip up to Nord Bay
Thank you very much. Those trout sure are beautiful fish. The colours, amazing.
dang, that pike was much bigger than I thought.  your season shames mine.  Let's go specklin' today.

Some awesome pics bud.Makes me realize just how little I've gotten out this winter. Thanks for sharing the awsome pics.  Facebook told me that today (Feb 17) was 4 years since you guys first brought me out on Nippissing. Seems like only yesterday.
killin it bruh  you seem to be fairing much better than we have this year...the struggle is real!
No matter how many times it happens, the moment you first see that big trout push out of the hole, it's pretty magical.
Joey, I was going to ask about the guy who's face you blanked out. Canada's Most Wanted?
Im sure they wouldn't have cared, but I didn't ask, so I didn't show.
Great pics. Bucket list.   #1 One month ice fishing guided by Joeytier.
